name: postgres-baseline
title: Hardening Framework Postgres Hardening Test Suite

controls.title: Postgresql should be running
controls.code:
control 'postgres-01' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Postgresql should be running'
  desc 'Postgresql should be running.'
  # describe service(postgres.service) do
  #   it { should be_installed }
  #   it { should be_running }
  #   it { should be_enabled }
  # end
  case os[:name]
  when 'ubuntu'
    case os[:release]
    when '12.04'
      describe command('/etc/init.d/postgresql status') do
        its('stdout') { should include 'online' }
      end
    when '14.04'
      describe command('service postgresql status') do
        its('stdout') { should include 'online' }
      end
    when '16.04'
      describe systemd_service(postgres.service) do
        it { should be_installed }
        it { should be_running }
        it { should be_enabled }
      end
    end
  when 'debian'
    case os[:release]
    when /7\./
      describe command('/etc/init.d/postgresql status') do
        its('stdout') { should include 'Running' }
      end
    end
  when 'redhat', 'centos', 'oracle', 'fedora'
    case os[:release]
    when /6\./
      describe command('/etc/init.d/postgresql-9.4 status') do
        its('stdout') { should include 'running' }
      end
    when /7\./
      describe command('ps aux | awk /\'bin\/postgres\'/ | wc -l') do
        its('stdout') { should include '1' }
      end
    end
  end
end

controls.title: Use stable postgresql version
controls.desc: Use only community or commercially supported version of the PostgreSQL software. Do not use RC, DEVEL oder BETA versions in a production environment.

descriptions.default: Use only community or commercially supported version of the PostgreSQL software. Do not use RC, DEVEL oder BETA versions in a production environment.

controls.title: Run one postgresql instance per operating system
controls.desc: Only one postgresql database instance must be running on an operating system instance (both physical HW or virtualized).

descriptions.default: Only one postgresql database instance must be running on an operating system instance (both physical HW or virtualized).

controls.code:
control 'postgres-03' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Run one postgresql instance per operating system'
  desc 'Only one postgresql database instance must be running on an operating system instance (both physical HW or virtualized).'
  pg_command = 'postgres'
  pg_command = 'postmaster' if os.redhat? && os.release.include?('6.')
  describe processes(pg_command) do
    its('list.length') { should eq 1 }
  end
end

controls.title: Only "c" and "internal" should be used as non-trusted procedural languages
controls.desc: If additional programming languages (e.g. plperl) are installed with non-trust mode, then it is possible to gain OS-level access permissions.

descriptions.default: If additional programming languages (e.g. plperl) are installed with non-trust mode, then it is possible to gain OS-level access permissions.

controls.code:
control 'postgres-04' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Only "c" and "internal" should be used as non-trusted procedural languages'
  desc 'If additional programming languages (e.g. plperl) are installed with non-trust mode, then it is possible to gain OS-level access permissions.'
  describe postgres_session(USER, PASSWORD).query('SELECT count (*) FROM pg_language WHERE lanpltrusted = \'f\' AND lanname!=\'internal\' AND lanname!=\'c\';') do
    its('output') { should eq '0' }
  end
end

controls.title: Set a password for each user
controls.desc: It tests for usernames which does not set a password.

descriptions.default: It tests for usernames which does not set a password.

controls.code:
control 'postgres-05' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Set a password for each user'
  desc 'It tests for usernames which does not set a password.'
  describe postgres_session(USER, PASSWORD).query('SELECT count(*) FROM pg_shadow WHERE passwd IS NULL;') do
    its('output') { should eq '0' }
  end
end

controls.title: Use salted MD5 to store postgresql passwords
controls.desc: Store postgresql passwords in salted hash format (e.g. salted MD5).

descriptions.default: Store postgresql passwords in salted hash format (e.g. salted MD5).

controls.code:
control 'postgres-06' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Use salted MD5 to store postgresql passwords'
  desc 'Store postgresql passwords in salted hash format (e.g. salted MD5).'
  describe postgres_session(USER, PASSWORD).query('SELECT passwd FROM pg_shadow;') do
    its('output') { should match(/^md5\S*$/) }
  end
  describe postgres_conf(POSTGRES_CONF_PATH) do
    its('password_encryption') { should eq 'on' }
  end
end

controls.title: Only the postgresql database administrator should have SUPERUSER, CREATEDB or CREATEROLE privileges.
controls.desc: Granting extensive privileges to ordinary users can cause various security problems, such as: intentional/ unintentional access, modification or destroying data

descriptions.default: Granting extensive privileges to ordinary users can cause various security problems, such as: intentional/ unintentional access, modification or destroying data

controls.code:
control 'postgres-07' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Only the postgresql database administrator should have SUPERUSER, CREATEDB or CREATEROLE privileges.'
  desc 'Granting extensive privileges to ordinary users can cause various security problems, such as: intentional/ unintentional access, modification or destroying data'
  describe postgres_session(USER, PASSWORD).query('SELECT count(*) FROM pg_roles WHERE rolsuper IS TRUE OR rolcreaterole IS TRUE or rolcreatedb IS TRUE;') do
    its('output') { should eq '1' }
  end
end

controls.title: Only the DBA should have privileges on pg_catalog.pg_authid table.
controls.desc: In pg_catalog.pg_authid table there are stored credentials such as username and password. If hacker has access to the table, then he can extract these credentials.

descriptions.default: In pg_catalog.pg_authid table there are stored credentials such as username and password. If hacker has access to the table, then he can extract these credentials.

controls.code:
control 'postgres-08' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Only the DBA should have privileges on pg_catalog.pg_authid table.'
  desc 'In pg_catalog.pg_authid table there are stored credentials such as username and password. If hacker has access to the table, then he can extract these credentials.'
  describe postgres_session(USER, PASSWORD).query('\dp pg_catalog.pg_authid') do
    its('output') { should eq 'pg_catalog | pg_authid | table | postgres=arwdDxt/postgres |' }
  end
end

controls.title: The PostgreSQL "data_directory" should be assigned exclusively to the database account (such as "postgres").
controls.desc: If file permissions on data are not property defined, other users may read, modify or delete those files.

descriptions.default: If file permissions on data are not property defined, other users may read, modify or delete those files.

controls.code:
control 'postgres-09' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'The PostgreSQL "data_directory" should be assigned exclusively to the database account (such as "postgres").'
  desc 'If file permissions on data are not property defined, other users may read, modify or delete those files.'
  find_command = 'find ' + POSTGRES_DATA.to_s + ' -user ' + USER + ' -group ' + USER + ' -perm /go=rwx'
  describe command(find_command) do
    its('stdout') { should eq '' }
  end
end

controls.title: The PostgreSQL config directory and file should be assigned exclusively to the database account (such as "postgres").
controls.desc: If file permissions on config files are not property defined, other users may read, modify or delete those files.

descriptions.default: If file permissions on config files are not property defined, other users may read, modify or delete those files.

controls.title: SSL is deactivated just for testing the chef-hardening-cookbook. It is recommended to activate ssl communication.
controls.desc: The chef-hardening-cookbook will delete the links from #var/lib/postgresql/#{node['postgresql']['version']}/main/server.crt to etc/ssl/certs/ssl-cert-snakeoil.pem and #var/lib/postgresql/#{node['postgresql']['version']}/main/server.key to etc/ssl/private/ssl-cert-snakeoil.key on Debian systems. This certificates are self-signed (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snake_oil_%28cryptography%29) and therefore not trusted. You have to #provide our own trusted certificates for SSL.

descriptions.default: The chef-hardening-cookbook will delete the links from #var/lib/postgresql/#{node['postgresql']['version']}/main/server.crt to etc/ssl/certs/ssl-cert-snakeoil.pem and #var/lib/postgresql/#{node['postgresql']['version']}/main/server.key to etc/ssl/private/ssl-cert-snakeoil.key on Debian systems. This certificates are self-signed (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snake_oil_%28cryptography%29) and therefore not trusted. You have to #provide our own trusted certificates for SSL.

controls.code:
control 'postgres-11' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'SSL is deactivated just for testing the chef-hardening-cookbook. It is recommended to activate ssl communication.'
  desc 'The chef-hardening-cookbook will delete the links from #var/lib/postgresql/#{node[\'postgresql\'][\'version\']}/main/server.crt to etc/ssl/certs/ssl-cert-snakeoil.pem and #var/lib/postgresql/#{node[\'postgresql\'][\'version\']}/main/server.key to etc/ssl/private/ssl-cert-snakeoil.key on Debian systems. This certificates are self-signed (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snake_oil_%28cryptography%29) and therefore not trusted. You have to #provide our own trusted certificates for SSL.'
  describe postgres_conf(POSTGRES_CONF_PATH) do
    its('ssl') { should eq 'off' }
  end
end

controls.title: Use strong chiphers for ssl communication
controls.desc: The following categories of SSL Ciphers must not be used: ADH, LOW, EXP and MD5. A very good description for secure postgres installation / configuration can be found at: https://bettercrypto.org

descriptions.default: The following categories of SSL Ciphers must not be used: ADH, LOW, EXP and MD5. A very good description for secure postgres installation / configuration can be found at: https://bettercrypto.org

controls.code:
control 'postgres-12' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'Use strong chiphers for ssl communication'
  desc 'The following categories of SSL Ciphers must not be used: ADH, LOW, EXP and MD5. A very good description for secure postgres installation / configuration can be found at: https://bettercrypto.org'
  describe postgres_conf(POSTGRES_CONF_PATH) do
    its('ssl_ciphers') { should eq 'ALL:!ADH:!LOW:!EXP:!MD5:@STRENGTH' }
  end
end

controls.title: Require MD5 for ALL users, peers in pg_hba.conf
controls.desc: Require MD5 for ALL users, peers in pg_hba.conf and do not allow untrusted authentication methods.

descriptions.default: Require MD5 for ALL users, peers in pg_hba.conf and do not allow untrusted authentication methods.

controls.title: We accept one peer and one ident for now (chef automation)
controls.desc: We accept one peer and one ident for now (chef automation)

descriptions.default: We accept one peer and one ident for now (chef automation)

controls.code:
control 'postgres-14' do
  impact 1.0
  title 'We accept one peer and one ident for now (chef automation)'
  desc 'We accept one peer and one ident for now (chef automation)'
  describe command('cat ' + POSTGRES_HBA_CONF_FILE.to_s + ' | egrep \'peer|ident\' | wc -l') do
    its('stdout') { should match(/^[2|1]/) }
  end
end
